text: 27 The next morning brought the following very unexpected letter from Isabella : _ Bath , April _
text_tokenized: 27 The next morning brought the following very unexpected letter from Isabella : _ Bath , April _

text: My dearest Catherine ,
text_tokenized: My dearest Catherine ,

text: I received your two kind letters with the greatest delight , and have a thousand apologies to make for not answering them sooner .
text_tokenized: I received your two kind letters with the greatest delight , and have a thousand apologies to make for not answering them sooner .

text: I
text_tokenized: I

text: really am quite ashamed of my idleness ; but in this horrid place one can find time for nothing .
text_tokenized: really am quite ashamed of my idleness ; but in this horrid place one can find time for nothing .

text: I have had my pen in my hand to begin a letter to you almost every day since you left Bath , but have always been prevented by some silly trifler or other .
text_tokenized: I have had my pen in my hand to begin a letter to you almost every day since you left Bath , but have always been prevented by some silly trifler or other .

text: Pray write to me soon , and direct to my own home .
text_tokenized: Pray write to me soon , and direct to my own home .

text: Thank God , we leave this vile place to - morrow .
text_tokenized: Thank God , we leave this vile place to - morrow .

text: Since you went away , I have had no pleasure in it — the dust is beyond anything ; and everybody one cares for is gone .
text_tokenized: Since you went away , I have had no pleasure in it — the dust is beyond anything ; and everybody one cares for is gone .

text: I believe if I could see you I should not mind the rest , for you are dearer to me than anybody can conceive .
text_tokenized: I believe if I could see you I should not mind the rest , for you are dearer to me than anybody can conceive .

text: I am quite uneasy about your dear brother , not having heard from him since he went to Oxford ; and am fearful of some misunderstanding .
text_tokenized: I am quite uneasy about your dear brother , not having heard from him since he went to Oxford ; and am fearful of some misunderstanding .

text: Your kind offices will set all right : he is the only man I ever did or could love , and I trust you will convince him of it .
text_tokenized: Your kind offices will set all right : he is the only man I ever did or could love , and I trust you will convince him of it .

text: The spring
text_tokenized: The spring

text: fashions are partly down ; and the hats the most frightful you can imagine .
text_tokenized: fashions are partly down ; and the hats the most frightful you can imagine .

text: I hope you spend your time pleasantly , but am afraid you never think of me .
text_tokenized: I hope you spend your time pleasantly , but am afraid you never think of me .

text: I will not say all that I could of the family you are with , because I would not be ungenerous , or set you against those you esteem ; but it is very difficult to know whom to trust , and young men never know their minds two days together .
text_tokenized: I will not say all that I could of the family you are with , because I would not be ungenerous , or set you against those you esteem ; but it is very difficult to know whom to trust , and young men never know their minds two days together .

text: I rejoice to say that the young man whom , of all others , I particularly abhor , has left Bath .
text_tokenized: I rejoice to say that the young man whom , of all others , I particularly abhor , has left Bath .

text: You will know , from this description , I must mean Captain Tilney , who , as you may remember , was amazingly disposed to follow and tease me , before you went away .
text_tokenized: You will know , from this description , I must mean Captain Tilney , who , as you may remember , was amazingly disposed to follow and tease me , before you went away .

text: Afterwards he got worse , and became quite my shadow .
text_tokenized: Afterwards he got worse , and became quite my shadow .

text: Many girls might have been taken in , for never were such attentions ; but I knew the fickle sex too well .
text_tokenized: Many girls might have been taken in , for never were such attentions ; but I knew the fickle sex too well .

text: He went away to his regiment two days ago , and I trust I shall never be plagued with him again .
text_tokenized: He went away to his regiment two days ago , and I trust I shall never be plagued with him again .

text: He is the greatest coxcomb I ever saw , and amazingly disagreeable .
text_tokenized: He is the greatest coxcomb I ever saw , and amazingly disagreeable .

text: The last two days he was always by the side of Charlotte Davis : I pitied his taste , but took no notice of him .
text_tokenized: The last two days he was always by the side of Charlotte Davis : I pitied his taste , but took no notice of him .

text: The last time we met was in Bath Street , and I turned directly into a shop that he might not speak to me ; I would not even look at him .
text_tokenized: The last time we met was in Bath Street , and I turned directly into a shop that he might not speak to me ; I would not even look at him .

text: He went into the pump - room afterwards ; but I would not have followed him for all the world .
text_tokenized: He went into the pump - room afterwards ; but I would not have followed him for all the world .

text: Such a contrast between him and your brother !
text_tokenized: Such a contrast between him and your brother !

text: pray send me some news of the latter — I am quite unhappy about him ; he seemed so uncomfortable when he went away , with a cold , or something that affected his spirits .
text_tokenized: pray send me some news of the latter — I am quite unhappy about him ; he seemed so uncomfortable when he went away , with a cold , or something that affected his spirits .

text: I would write to him myself , but have mislaid his direction ; and , as I hinted above , am afraid he took something in my conduct amiss .
text_tokenized: I would write to him myself , but have mislaid his direction ; and , as I hinted above , am afraid he took something in my conduct amiss .

text: Pray explain everything to his satisfaction ; or , if he still harbours any doubt , a line from himself to me , or a call at Putney when next in town , might set all to rights .
text_tokenized: Pray explain everything to his satisfaction ; or , if he still harbours any doubt , a line from himself to me , or a call at Putney when next in town , might set all to rights .

text: I have not been to the Rooms this age , nor to the play , except going in last night with the Hodges , for a frolic , at half price :
text_tokenized: I have not been to the Rooms this age , nor to the play , except going in last night with the Hodges , for a frolic , at half price :

text: they teased me into it ; and I was determined they should not say I shut myself up because Tilney was gone .
text_tokenized: they teased me into it ; and I was determined they should not say I shut myself up because Tilney was gone .

text: We happened to sit by the Mitchells , and they pretended to be quite surprised to see me out .
text_tokenized: We happened to sit by the Mitchells , and they pretended to be quite surprised to see me out .

text: I knew their spite : at one time they could not be civil to me , but now they are all friendship ; but I am not such a fool as to be taken in by them .
text_tokenized: I knew their spite : at one time they could not be civil to me , but now they are all friendship ; but I am not such a fool as to be taken in by them .

text: You know I have a pretty good spirit of my own .
text_tokenized: You know I have a pretty good spirit of my own .

text: Anne Mitchell had tried to put on a turban like mine , as I wore it the week before at the Concert , but made wretched work of it — it happened to become my odd face , I believe , at least Tilney told me so at the time , and said every eye was upon me ; but he is the last man whose word I would take .
text_tokenized: Anne Mitchell had tried to put on a turban like mine , as I wore it the week before at the Concert , but made wretched work of it — it happened to become my odd face , I believe , at least Tilney told me so at the time , and said every eye was upon me ; but he is the last man whose word I would take .

text: I wear nothing but purple now : I know I look hideous in it , but no matter — it is your dear brother ’s favourite colour .
text_tokenized: I wear nothing but purple now : I know I look hideous in it , but no matter — it is your dear brother ’s favourite colour .

text: Lose no time , my dearest , sweetest Catherine , in writing to him and to me , Who ever am , etc . Such a strain of shallow artifice could not impose even upon Catherine .
text_tokenized: Lose no time , my dearest , sweetest Catherine , in writing to him and to me , Who ever am , etc . Such a strain of shallow artifice could not impose even upon Catherine .

text: Its inconsistencies , contradictions , and falsehood struck her from the very first .
text_tokenized: Its inconsistencies , contradictions , and falsehood struck her from the very first .

text: She was ashamed of Isabella , and ashamed of having ever loved her .
text_tokenized: She was ashamed of Isabella , and ashamed of having ever loved her .

text: Her professions of attachment were now as disgusting as her excuses were empty , and her demands impudent .
text_tokenized: Her professions of attachment were now as disgusting as her excuses were empty , and her demands impudent .

text: “ Write to James on her behalf !
text_tokenized: “ Write to James on her behalf !

text: no , James should never hear Isabella ’s name mentioned by her again . ”
text_tokenized: no , James should never hear Isabella ’s name mentioned by her again . ”

text: On Henry ’s arrival from Woodston , she made known to him and Eleanor their brother ’s safety , congratulating them with sincerity on it , and reading aloud the most material passages of her letter with strong indignation .
text_tokenized: On Henry ’s arrival from Woodston , she made known to him and Eleanor their brother ’s safety , congratulating them with sincerity on it , and reading aloud the most material passages of her letter with strong indignation .

text: When she had finished it—“So much for Isabella , ” she cried , “ and for all our intimacy !
text_tokenized: When she had finished it—“So much for Isabella , ” she cried , “ and for all our intimacy !

text: she must think me an idiot , or she could not have written so ; but perhaps this has served to make
text_tokenized: she must think me an idiot , or she could not have written so ; but perhaps this has served to make

text: her
text_tokenized: her

text: character better known to me than mine is to her
text_tokenized: character better known to me than mine is to her

text: I see what she has been about .
text_tokenized: I see what she has been about .

text: She is a vain coquette , and her tricks have not answered .
text_tokenized: She is a vain coquette , and her tricks have not answered .

text: I do not believe she had ever any regard either for James or for me , and I wish I had never known her .
text_tokenized: I do not believe she had ever any regard either for James or for me , and I wish I had never known her .

text: “ It will soon be as if you never had , ” said Henry .
text_tokenized: “ It will soon be as if you never had , ” said Henry .

text: “ There is but one thing that I can not understand .
text_tokenized: “ There is but one thing that I can not understand .

text: I see that she has had designs on Captain Tilney , which have not succeeded ; but I do not understand what Captain Tilney has been about all this time .
text_tokenized: I see that she has had designs on Captain Tilney , which have not succeeded ; but I do not understand what Captain Tilney has been about all this time .

text: Why should he pay her such attentions as to make her quarrel with my brother , and then fly off himself ?
text_tokenized: Why should he pay her such attentions as to make her quarrel with my brother , and then fly off himself ?

text: “ I have very little to say for Frederick ’s motives , such as I believe them to have been .
text_tokenized: “ I have very little to say for Frederick ’s motives , such as I believe them to have been .

text: He has his vanities as well as Miss Thorpe , and the chief difference is , that , having a stronger head , they have not yet injured himself .
text_tokenized: He has his vanities as well as Miss Thorpe , and the chief difference is , that , having a stronger head , they have not yet injured himself .

text: If the _ effect _ of his behaviour does not justify him with you , we had better not seek after the cause . ”
text_tokenized: If the _ effect _ of his behaviour does not justify him with you , we had better not seek after the cause . ”

text: “ Then you do not suppose he ever really cared about her ?
text_tokenized: “ Then you do not suppose he ever really cared about her ?

text: “ I am persuaded that he never did . ” “ And only made believe to do so for mischief ’s sake ? ” Henry bowed his assent .
text_tokenized: “ I am persuaded that he never did . ” “ And only made believe to do so for mischief ’s sake ? ” Henry bowed his assent .

text: “ Well , then , I must say that I do not like him at all .
text_tokenized: “ Well , then , I must say that I do not like him at all .

text: Though it has turned out so well for us , I do not like him at all .
text_tokenized: Though it has turned out so well for us , I do not like him at all .

text: As it happens , there is no great harm done , because I do not think Isabella has any heart to lose .
text_tokenized: As it happens , there is no great harm done , because I do not think Isabella has any heart to lose .

text: But , suppose he had made her very much in love with him ? ”
text_tokenized: But , suppose he had made her very much in love with him ? ”

text: “ But we must first suppose Isabella to have had a heart to lose — consequently to have been a very different creature ; and , in that case , she would have met with very different treatment . ” “ It is very right that you should stand by your brother . ”
text_tokenized: “ But we must first suppose Isabella to have had a heart to lose — consequently to have been a very different creature ; and , in that case , she would have met with very different treatment . ” “ It is very right that you should stand by your brother . ”

text: “ And if you would stand by _ yours _ , you would not be much distressed by the disappointment of Miss Thorpe .
text_tokenized: “ And if you would stand by _ yours _ , you would not be much distressed by the disappointment of Miss Thorpe .

text: But your mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity , and therefore not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality , or a desire of revenge . ” Catherine was complimented out of further bitterness .
text_tokenized: But your mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity , and therefore not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality , or a desire of revenge . ” Catherine was complimented out of further bitterness .

text: Frederick could not be unpardonably guilty , while Henry made himself so agreeable .
text_tokenized: Frederick could not be unpardonably guilty , while Henry made himself so agreeable .

text: She resolved on not answering Isabella ’s letter , and tried to think no more of it .
text_tokenized: She resolved on not answering Isabella ’s letter , and tried to think no more of it .
